channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: By the big tree outside 33 Kenilworth road, 4th December
item.description:
Big cardboard box of TV and another box dumped by the big tree outside 33 Kenilworth Road. This is a well known dumping ground and it so happens that the boxes have the dumper’s address still stuck to it! It has come from 33A Kenilworth Road. They have used this tree to dump their stuff before but now you can see this for yourself, clear as day. Please take action. This type of fly tipping is unacceptable.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kenilworth Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Camden council and Veolia not acting on reports, 4th December
item.description:
FixMyStreet ref: 8501782. As per original reports no 8500058 and 8501782. Leaves from the road and the pavement have not been cleared this autumn at all. Veolia only cleans the main roads e.g. Lady Somerset, Burghley Rdetc. it IS the Council’s responsibility so please resolve instead of closing the report and writing ‘not the council’s responsibility’. There has been a visible decline in street cleaning in the NW5 area (including dog waste not being cleaned) since Veolia has got their 8 years contract extension last summer. Council and Veolia need to sort it out and stop sending the residents away saying it’s not their responsibility. Camden council has just been notified about the flooding herein. The responsibility ultimately lies with Camden council (who’s responsible for liaising with its subcontractors). if the flooding repeats and damages the nearby properties it will be Camden council that will be sued for not acting on repeated resident reports
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Burghley Road, Tufnell Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
